headline: Shamrock Shakes
description: Learn how to make a shamrock shake on St. Patrick's Day with this easy recipe for a green, mint-flavored milkshake sweetened with chocolate syrup.

video.description: Frozen decadence with vanilla ice cream and mint extract.
video.name: Shamrock Shakes

name: Shamrock Shakes
recipeIngredient: 0.25 teaspoon mint extract, or more to taste
2 tablespoons chocolate syrup, or to taste
2 tablespoons whipped cream, or to taste
0.5 teaspoon green decorator sugar, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Blend together ice cream, milk, mint extract, and food coloring in a blender until smooth.
Drizzle chocolate syrup around the inside of 2 tall glasses; pour shake into the glasses. Top with whipped cream and green sugar.

review.reviewBody: I didn't not have mint extract. So I used mint chocolate chip ice cream instead of vanilla . It was delicious

My kids love these shakes. They love shakes, period, but especially these. We have a ‘fun Friday’ night every week and I rotate a different treat after dinner. These shakes are usually at the top of the request list. I add more ice cream and less milk. Because as is, it’s too runny. I also add crushed up thin mints cookies or mint oreos to the top and sometimes use mint chip ice cream. Delish

This is a great recipe. I made it vegan by using coconut-based vanilla ice cream (that doesn’t taste like coconut), whole fat Next Milk, and vegan True Whip. I actually put a little of the chocolate syrup in the shake mix because it wasn’t sweet enough without it. Delicious. Tasted like mint ice cream. And I hate McD’s shamrock shakes…homemade is perfection.
These are a delicious sweet treat! My spouse craves 'Shamrock shakes" and these are just as good, if not better.

It didn't taste good, despite its natural and fresh dairy ingredients. The mint tasted weak but adding more made it taste awful.
It was not the delicious concoction I thought it would be.
The flavour was great but we had to add extra ice cream because it was very runny.
looks pretty ... and is so YUMMY
Im heavy handed..lol, oops. Kids loved it & enjoyed thr strong mint flavor. Followed recipe & turned it great, I just added a little to much due to not measuring & eyeing everything.
It's a winner! Followed others advice and used less milk.
There was no left overs. For a richer taste add Malted Milk powder.
I make my own homemade vanilla ice cream add milk to consistanty to a thicker shake. Two teaspoons of mint extract 8 drops of green food coloring and top with whip cream.

As many other reviewers posted, this recipe called for too much milk. I tried this recipe as written, but next time I will try less milk and maybe double the mint extract. Otherwise, it was very good and it has the potential to be great with a few tweaks.
I made this with these two exceptions: 1/2 teaspoon of mint flavoring, and heavy cream instead of milk. So much thicker and creamier. Yum!
yum.
My teenagers were seriously impressed. Thanks for making me a hero!
ok
It's like the one from McDonal's but without all the food coloring
McDonald's has nothing on these!
We made this in one of my classes, we all loved it. I will be making again next year!

I like it with more mint flavoring so instead of only using 1/4 tsp I put in 1/2 tsp instead which made it more of a "shamrock shake" for me. I also added 2 tbsp of sweetened condensed milk which made it more creamy and added just the right amount of sweetness for the kiddos :)

Made these last night for our annual St. Patrick's day party and everyone loved them. The recipe says mint but I would suggest using peppermint extract I made a different recipe with the mint extract and it ruined it it was like eating a toothepaste flavored dessert.
To make it more an adult beverage I only put in a cup of milk and 1/4 of Bailey's . Everyone loved it. Will definitely make again!
Added extra ice cream to thicken it up some but other than that, it's spot on! Delicious!

This is perfect with my homemade ice cream and I intend on making it for many upcoming events. I found that if I use my homemade mint ice cream, it was one of the most delicious deserts I've ever consumed. I highly suggest making this (not everyday) because it's way better then what you will or will ever get somewhere else.
I used mint chocolate chip ice cream, and half the amount of mint extract. So good!!! I'm obsessed

Made this twice this weekend! Some recipes say not to use peppermint extract, but that was all I had on hand and it worked just fine. As others stated, I added less milk...probably 1 cup of milk per 2 cups of ice cream. I will never again buy a Shamrock shake from McDonald's! Last year when I got one, it tasted a bit odd and I think it was the dye they used. And...for about $6 I was able to make about 10 shakes for my family.
YES
This was fantastic! I made it exactly like the recipe with Haagen-Daz vanilla and it was a big hit with the whole family! We will be making these at home from now on!!

Wow! I loved this recipe! I didn't have any mint extract so I put in a bunch of after eight chocolates and blended them along with it and it gave it a nice minty taste. I also added a bit more ice cream to make it thicker. Thanks so much for the recipe! I will definitely make it again!!

This recipe was definitely a hit this St. Patrick's Day!
Thank you for sharing!
Made this before, but without the chocolate. This sounds great, going to try this on St. Patricks Day. I think Joe BDA used creme de menthe and had a few of these shakes before adding his review.
Made these for a work st paddys lunch, they were a huge hit!
Measured by eye. So refreshing and fun to serve.
These are so good! I used less milk, start with 1 cup and add more as needed. But I like these thick. Who needs to go to McDonald's now?
Oh I always make this! It's sooo good! My family always loves it when I make it! Defiantly good
Delicous

THANK YOU! Our local fast-food chain's shake machine was "down", and I really needed my annual Shamrock Shake fix, FAST! This reminded me that, yes, I am capable of making my own shakes, and I can also control what goes into them, too! I didn't measure anything, but I used approximately equal amounts of milk and ice cream, a splash of mint extract, a couple drops of green food coloring, and it came out perfectly! I will be making this every St. Patrick's Day, and any other time the mood strikes me!
Delicious!

This was great! I didn't measure the milk, just kept adding until it was the consistancy that I wanted. Great flavor and very pretty to look at. The girls loved this for a treat today after lunch. I will be making these again~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
Definitely use less milk. I used only 1 cup and it was still too much. Very watery shake. And don't doubt the mint for peppermint. It tasted very good.
I just made a ton of this stuff. Everyone loved it. I would use less milk though. Maybe start off with one cup (which was perfect for us), and add more if you need to.
I doubled this recipe. I used Turkey Hill Vanilla Bean ice cream, I cut back on the milk by half (for a thicker shake) and added a touch more mint flavoring. The kids and I drank every bit of this.
